dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Never seen you before.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm new here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You say that like it's a problem.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You sure about that? You're so drunk, you're barely sitting up straight.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Take my advice. Move on. Get offworld if you can. If you can't, get to the Bay.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I been halfway around T1... heh. Monarch, they call it now. Been around it twice. Stood at the Hot Pole and the Cold.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Nothing on this moon for nobody. Just a lotta heartbreak.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's your story?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Heartbreak? What happened to you here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Pay 20 Bits> Buy yourself a drink.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's pretty simple, kid. I sit at the bar. I drink. I mind my own business. That's it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You said you've been around the whole moon. You must know a few things no one else does.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I can buy you a bottle, or I can bust one over your head. And don't call me "kid."

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I overheard somebody saying you were the best to ask about the real Monarch.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: The only thing I got to teach is, "get the fuck off T1." Or whatever they're calling is this week. Anybody with half a brain could tell you that.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look. You want to buy the drinks, I'll do my bit to keep you entertained. Just don't ask me to dance.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Denting my skull would be a waste of perfectly good alcohol. I got two exes who'd vouch.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Whoever said that must've been lying. Or maybe they was drunk. I don't know nothing a dozen better folk couldn't tell you.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: A great many things. I'll tell you what - you want to listen to an old man ramble, might be a job in it for you.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I used to run with a squad of mercenaries here. Good folk. Fella named Lamont introduced me. Thing is, I ain't seen them in an age.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Stands to reason they got themselves ate.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Mercenaries? What'd they do?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Was this a long time ago?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If they got killed, they must not have been terribly talented.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Mostly we protected folk from the beasts here. If it spat, scratched or stung, we'd kill it for you, so long as you had the bits.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: We split ways 'round the time this twice-fucked moon got abandoned.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Thing is, I got myself some fond memories. We had some keepsakes of ours we kept in a lockbox, and I've been thinkin' about seeing it found.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You want... mementos? What, photographs, or...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What if they're still alive?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Can't you find them yourself?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: All right. One lockbox, coming right up.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll think about it.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Thereabouts.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll be glad for it, but I ain't stupid. This planet tends to get people killed. I just want some closure.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm getting on in years, kid. Legs ain't working like they used to. Sulfur burns a little too long in the lungs. This joint's looking like my last home.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Appreciate it, kid. I'll mark an outpost on your map - we spent a lot of time out there. Might be a good place to start. Here's a key for the door.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: You do that. I'll be here doing the very same.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, sure. I was with 'em when the corps were leaving Monarch. Hell of a time, that.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Better folk than you and me. It don't take much of a slip to end up in a sulfur pool or a rapt's stomach.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I can't repay no kindnesses, now.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: All right, so... I reckon one of the most interesting places I been is the Hot Pole. You know what that is?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've got no idea.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If I knew anything about Monarch, I wouldn't be asking you.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: This moon ain't big enough to rotate. It's locked, one side always facing Olympus, the other always facing away.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Olympus might not be a star, but it throws off assloads of heat. Monarch's Hot Pole is the part that's always closest to the gas giant.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's in the middle of this big mountain plateau. Volcanoes so high, the peaks are in space.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If there's no air, how did you survive?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So it's hot, it's high, and there's no air. Or not much. Nice views, though.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sounds like a boring place. Nothing could live there.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: O2 breathers. The heat from Olympus is worse, though. Close your eyes, you can see rays bursting through your eyeballs. Little streaks of light.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: The funny thing is, dead in the middle there's just smooth rock. Circular-like. All the dust blown away. Pale gray, with hair-fine cracks all over.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I don't know what I was thinking - maybe I was light-headed from the O2. But I felt like I ought to take off the breather for a moment, and put my ear to the ground.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: ...and?

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I wonder now if I imagined it. A trick of the air. The heat.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: It was at the edge of hearing. Deep down, far off. Irregular. Tap-tap-tap. Tap-tap. Tap-tap-tap.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: The sound of a bird pecking out of a shell.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You made that whole thing up.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You had me going there a minute. Good story. Definitely worth the drink.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well that's fucking terrifying.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's it mean?

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: You go on and tell yourself that.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: When there's a groundquake now, I hold my breath. Because I don't know if it's Olympus squeezing us with gravity...

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: ...or wings getting stretched.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Heh. I don't like to tell that one sober. Get the shakes something fierce.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hell if I know.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I found it peaceful. No wind. No animals. No people. You ever heard *nothing?* You hold your breath, and nothing? It's... profound.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Fair enough.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Not for me. Maybe for you. You come out here looking for some better life, kid?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: "Better life?" On this shithole moon?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Do people actually come here? Like... willingly?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Just passing through.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Maybe not in this particular town. But in general, sure.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ain't that the fucking truth.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Buncha corporate-types from Tee-Two flew in last month. Paid SubLight to bring them.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: After two weeks, all but one of them were dead. Rapts. Mantis. Fungus. Storm. And that last fella? His brain broke.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Good on you. Make a little money, move on. Don't get killed out there, kid.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: That ain't likely to happen on T1. Monarch. Whatever they call this shithole now.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Take my advice. Get yourself a berth offworld. Anywhere. Don't look back. Just keep flying.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: I may not remember today tomorrow, but I damn well remember yesterday now.

dialog.speaker: Kane (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wait. I mean- Nah, that's what I meant.
